item.title: Emacs
item.description: Basic configuration General commands Console-size split screen MELPA package repository Solarized theme For R Emacs Speaks Statistics Auto-complete Smart underscores Poly-mode for R + Markdown Custom keyboard shortcuts For writing Spell checking Thesaurus and synonyms Grammar checking For LaTeX Word count Chunk folding For Markdown Table formatting Markdown live preview For Python Elpy python mode Send commands to a specific buffer For C/CPP Tags For Shell For file manipulation CSV/TSV Dired mode For Version Control For online notes Evernote Simplenote File encryption For OSX Maximize window at opening Keybindings Ispell Explicit path definition I use Emacs for almost everything: coding, writing, taking notes, preparing presentations.

item.title: Expression
item.description: Writing General Starting the sentence Explanation Not sure Opening Nice expression/style Introduce the second part of a sentence Introduction/reviews Intro the intro Pionner work Changing subject More Closing Discussion Oral Expression Advices Writing Some recommendations from Sportscience: i.e. and e.g. only within parenthesis (is that a thing?) aim for economy. However or synonyms at most once per paragraph. while/since for time related stuff, not instead of whereas/although/because.

item.title: LaTeX
item.description: Standard packages TinyTeX Misc Font sizes Change the symbol in lists Math calligraphy Languages and encoding Links Table of contents Metadata Figures Position Sub-figures Supplementary figures Tables Control tabular width Supplementary tables Spanning columns/rows Align columns Rectangular selection/cut/paste Tables from R Code blocks For manuscripts Abstract Author affiliation Text formatting Notes/comments Main text and supplements in two documents Compare versions and highlight revisions One figure = one file Bibliography Reduce long list of authors “Name Year” style Order of initials No URL or DOI Presentations Changing the font Section slides Themes Backup slides Link to frame Standard packages This is my default (more or less) :

item.title: Markdown
item.description: Tips Converting Markdown into nice HTML pages Converting Markdown into slides Jekyll websites Themes Table of Contents Math formulas blogdown websites Themes Table of Contents Draft posts Math formulas Bibliography R Markdown Tips / to add some vertical space/break. Use two ` and a space to escape ` in inline code. E.g `` `pwd` `` gives `pwd`. --- to add horizontal line/separation. Converting Markdown into nice HTML pages I use RMarkdown.

item.title: Math/Stats
item.description: Probability distributions Binomial Hypergeometric Normal Poisson Beta-binomial Beta Statistical tests Student t-test Fisher’s exact test \(\chi^2\) test Wilcoxon test ANOVA Regression & Machine Learning Linear regression LASSO LOESS Machine Learning basics CART Neural Networks SVM Misc stats Markov Model Monte Carlo methods MCMC Hidden Markov Model Maximum Likelihood Estimation Expectation-Maximization Greedy algorithm Bayesian vs Frequentist Graph theory De Bruijn graphs Hamiltonian path Euclidian path Algebra SVD decomposition PCA All of this is mostly extracted from Wikipedia.

item.title: Python
item.description: Naming and formatting Objects Array Hash Class String Function Input/Output Module, files, imports Packaging code Install a module locally Passing arguments to a script Graphs Shell integration Timing Bioinfo Sequences Fasta SAM files VCF Tricks Some notes on my recent attempt to learn Python. Naming and formatting Use lowercase _-separated for modules and functions name. E.g. my_function. Use CapsWord for classes. E.g. MyClass. Use _ prefix for private variable.

item.title: R
item.description: Details to remember Order in condition assessment Graphs ggplot2 tricks Align/stack two ggplots Change font in ggplot2 Waffle graphs Rmarkdown Beamer presentation Jekyll website data.table package Linux setup Details to remember Use rbindlist from data.table package for a memory-optimized and faster do.call(rbind, list(..)). Use system2 instead of system to run a command. It’s more portable apparently. Get RPubs working with options(rpubs.upload.method = "internal"). Operations on dates using strptime(x, "%a %b %d %T PST %Y'") and difftime and then as.

item.title: Shell
item.description: Misc Colors in less Avoid killing ssh jobs rsync One-liners Bash & Pipes AWK Perl one-liners Shell scripting Variables If Then Else Convert PDF Git Docker cheatsheet Makefile Modules OSX Mount server Setup WD Elements external hard drive Misc Redirect stderr to stdout: 2>&1. Colors in less Use the -r or -R option. Sometimes the previous command needs a parameter make sure the output includes color codes.

item.title: Internet
item.description: DuckDuckGo Ubuntu Sync a specific Google Drive folder on Ubuntu Sync PDFs between Mendeley and Google Drive Host HTML documents in Dropbox DuckDuckGo DuckDuckGo is a “search engine that doesn’t track you”. It provides nice “bangs” to search directly specific websites. By making DDG the default search engine these bangs can be used directly in the address bar. !pub PubMed. !scholar Google Scholar. !bioc Bioconductor. !so Stack Overflow.

item.title: About
item.description: About this website This is where I put all the useful information I keep on forgetting. Instead of googling the same things over and over, wasting time and server energy I put them here. It’s like a second memory, better than my hippocampus, my hippocamPLUS… About me Personal page with links. Twitter. My current lab Computational Genomics Lab at UCSC. Genomics Institute at UCSC My previous labs Bourque Lab.
